summary: This bill, the Protecting Military Parental Leave Evaluations Act, aims to protect members of the Armed Forces who take parental leave. It addresses concerns that taking leave might negatively impact performance evaluations. The bill directs the Secretary of Defense to create regulations exempting members taking parental leave exceeding 31 consecutive days from performance evaluations and to allow leave within a two-year period without waivers. A report to relevant committees is also required.
